review_text: A great hotel at a very good location for a reasonable price. Rooms are simple (for instance, the living room was pretty bare) but are well maintained and cleaned daily. I stayed in a suite at a high floor. It offered an unblocked view of the Vancouver suburbs, with minimal tall buildings blocking the view. Safety: Surrounding neighbourhood is safe. Walkability: Crystal Mall has a lot of Asian (specifically Chinese) shops and eateries. Metropolis at Metrotown is within walking distance and offers a huge selection of shopping (e.g. Walmart and Canadian Superstore). Food & drinks: Breakfast buffet service is available for a fee and the spread is decent, certainly on par with Hilton breakfasts.

We just returned from our stay and could not be happier with our hotel experience.  This location was perfect for our needs. Several great restaurants across the street and the concierge did a great job helping us find everything.  The hotel rooms were spacious and clean. Prices were very reasonable.  This was a family trip to see Vancouver and we are so happy we chose this hotel.

The rooms are clean, the bathtubs are amazing. We stayed there the night of our wedding and it was great We misses breakfast and the lady in the kitchen made us breakfast anyway. Have a super nice the staff like above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Walkability: Super close to metrotown and the sky train, making it very accessible and in a great location Food & drinks: The omelets were amazing. The kitchen stuff was helpful and incredibly kind

Had a great stay here. Room was clean and comfortable, we had a suite which was nice. The Breakfast Buffet included for Gold Members was very good, lots of options. Location is super convenient next to the Skytrain (easy ride downtown) and malls/shopping. Price was a lot cheaper than staying downtown but still well located. Parking wasnt too bad for an urban area. Only complaint is one morning, I think they only had one elevator running, and we literally waited on our floor for an elevator for about 15 minutes (5 minutes for the first which was already full, then another 10 for the second which had room). But I think that was a short lived problem, the rest of the stay we didnt have any issues.

Super clean and friendly staff. Not super conveniently located but they do have a few restaurants downstairs at the Crystal Mall. Parking is underground and confusing. This might be my new hotel when I visit BC The restaurant in the hotel(3rd floor) is also pretty good. The staff there are also super friendly.

Wonderful hotel to stay in. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and clean as well. There was a microwave in our room, which was a great plus to reheat any of the food we bought back as leftovers from downstairs in the Crystal Mall! The hotel itself is situated in a great town center with many different shopping centers surrounding it and malls within walking distance, as well as easy access to public transportation to get downtown. My only issue were the two days in a row of an unexpected wake up call of the fire alarms going off at 6:30am. Even so, I would stay here again and do highly recommend it for anyone looking for a hotel to stay in!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Jacklyn, Thank you for the great comments, we are leased you enjoyed your stay! Sorry about the fire alarms, we have brought the monitor company in to inspect the system to ensure that will not happen again. Cheers, Michael

review_text: Since our arrival all the staff we met was very pleasant, especially at the reception (night time) and Tinny from housecleaning service. She was nice, efficient and very polite! The room is very clean. I will definitely come back.

We used the Hilton Vancouver Metrotown as a place for our wedding guests to stay. A big thank you to Elaine for setting up our wedding block. The process was smooth and easy. A link was given for our guests to book rooms directly and of course calling in was an option as well. Our guests enjoyed staying at Hilton Metrotown and venturing out in the surrounding area from the mall to the restaurants & shops. Such a nice area. Highly recommend Hilton Vancouver Metrotown!

My overall experience was amazing. Liza at the front desk was very friendly and looked after my needs. The hotel staff who brought up some extra towels were very kind and helpful. The room was a bit dusty, but that is completely okay as we did not need to reach those areas. The part that may have been a downside is the parking gates as one has to go around to make sure you are at the hotel gates as the other is for the mall which closes at a specific time. The front desk agent was very helpful when we called to make sure how to get back in. Our view was from the 12th floor, so it really had an amazing view and walking distance from Metropolis mall and connected to the Crystal Mall for convenience.

Loved our stay here! I took my mom to B.C. for her birthday but wanted a location that wasn t directly downtown. This location is perfect because it s a 2 minute walk to the Metropolis Mall. It s also a 5 minute walk from the Skytrain, in a nice area. The staff at this location were amazing, very kind and attentive. When heading back to the airport we had an Uber cancel on us, however staff acted swiftly and we had a taxi in less than a minute (no joke). The rooms were very clean and tidy, with daily cleaning available. I would definitely stay here again! Safety: Very safe. Walkability: 2 mins from the Metropolis Mall, 5 min from Skytrain - everything you need is all in on one block.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your kind comments Sharnica, So glad you and your Mom had a great stay and happy belated birthday to her! Cheers, Michael

review_text: Stayed here for our church group conference. Phoned downstairs asking for extra towels. No one showed up. They know that there would be four people staying there and only put three towels.

The Hilton Vancouver Metrotown is incredible centrally located, well looked after and the staff are excellent. I worked with Jennifer Yolanda at the Sales Team for my booking and she was incredible attentive and detail oriented. Would highly recommend for any stay or meeting booking. Noteworthy details: Spacious meeting rooms for a variety of booking needs

Everything from check-in, room stay, to check-out was great and deserved a 9.9 stars/10. However, it was a false alarmed fire evacuation that we have to give less stars due to the hotels lack of leadership and direction in helping guests to evacuate safely. My family had to stay in the middle of the fire escape stair well (in 12th Floor) to help a helpless handicapped person with no hotel personnel around to help him.  Our two teenage kids were finally able to help this person to safety on ground floor outside the front door. On a bright side, we would like to recognize one of the hotels reception hostesses, Ms. Chloe Duong, who has been very exemplary and went above and beyond her duties to offer us more guides & travel tips about your great city as well as pointing us to other Hilton facilities in Canada for our next travels.  She has represented Hilton well and we have been most impressed with her professionalism, poise, and cheerful positive attitude.  She has earned a 5/5 stars rating from us! Nearby activities: The hotel is next a a shopping mall which offers great convenience!

From the moment we walked in, the Front Desk and Concierge were very friendly and accommodating! We arrived before check-in time as we had an early flight in and the Front Desk was able to check us in early and find a great room for us, also we felt welcomed as Diamond members. Rooms were very spacious and clean! Housekeeping staff greeted us every morning. Great selection at the breakfast buffet and our waiter was very friendly as well. Location was also really close to Metrotown station, the mall, and yummy food nearby. Overall amazing service all around which made our stay one of the best weve had!

Ive stayed here a handful of times now and I have no complaints. (Full disclosure, I am a Diamond member with the brand). Breakfast is delicious, the complimentary upgrades are always wonderful, and I love having access to a hot tub whenever I stay. The location is the perfect walking distance to the SkyTrain, so I can zip into downtown Vancouver without the price of staying downtown Vancouver.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks Amelia! We appreciate your comments and being a Diamond Member!  See you again soon. Cheers, Michael

review_text: Beautifully maintained hotel. Super staff all friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious, very clean, very comfortable beds. Restaurant and bar are great, food and drinks much better than typical hotel fare. Executive Lounge on 18th floor. Nearby activities: Attached to Crystal Mall, a large mostly Chinese related shopping and dining center with a huge supermarket and food court. Other shopping and dining within a couple of blocks. Walkability: So much nearby, easy walking in the neighborhood including several parks Food & drinks: Hotel restaurant serves a very nice breakfast buffet, and the dinner menu has good variety. Food is not just heated up fare but well crafted and prepared. Cocktails from the bar are excellent.

Excellent hotel close to many restaurants...easy parking! Very clean & well maintained rooms and common areas! Great water pressure in the shower! Rooms: Very clean Safety: Very safe area Walkability: Easy to access nearby restaurants Food & drinks: Breakfast was amazing...smokey bacon!

Best location. Visiting from USA and this area was super convenient to all the touristy attractions (20-30)min away from hikes and the mall is 5 min walk. Special thank you to Rupama who checked us in and gave us the best advice on which restaurants and attractions to go to. As a Hilton Honors member, I wish all Hiltons were ran and staffed like this one.
Amazing hotel, great service and great food. Also includes free access to their 3 heated pools and gym. The big shopping centre is a 2 minute from the hotel itself. Would definitely recommend.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Lqckq, Appreciate the great comments and we look forward to hosting you again soon. Cheers, Michael

review_text: Raj is amazing! He helped make our stay enjoyable: helped with EV parking and charging and room upgrade as a Hilton member. Thank you!

Overall very good, room very spacious and clean and shampoo, conditioner, body wash were good value, parking was bit far and hard to find. Rooms: very spacious Nearby activities: Metrotown is very close.

I don t have any negative comments. I m a regular here and I always get awesome service. The staff are so helpful and caring.  When I get to the hotel my bag is already in my room waiting for me.  The hotel is further away from the job location but well worth it.  The restaurant on site is really great too.  Everyone feels like family to me.  I would highly recommend.  A special kudos to the front desk. Always going above and beyond for me.

I came here on a work trip. The location is perfect: 5 minute walk from the skytrain and minutes from shopping & restaurants. Hotel service was excellent at check-in and out. I didnt use any amenities, housekeeping or room service, so I cannot comment on those. They do provide a discount ($10 off) for the breakfast ($30) but I didnt use it nor did I go to the restaurant. The room was very clean and spacious. I had requested a king bed but received 2 queens (my work booked the room so not sure if there had been a communication-issue at that step). I liked the blackout curtains and found the room mostly quiet - you could hear the skytrain but not my neighbours. The AC/heating fan was loud but that just may be something they do to drown out any other possible noise. Overall, a very nice place to stay.

I had a nice stay at the Hilton Metrotown. The location is excellent. 5 mins walk away from the closest metro station, and you were in Downtown Vancouver in 15-20 minutes via a direct Skytrain. There were lots of food options around the hotel as well, and the hotel has a nice open-air swimming pool and hot tub. The rooms and washrooms were clean and spacious, and the beds were very comfortable. Being a Gold member of Hilton Honors makes a big difference when staying at this hotel, as otherwise breakfast is not included. However, the breakfast was very basic and did not have too many options.
response_from_owner_text: We value you as a Hilton Honors member and are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and our fantastic location, Rafay. Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding the breakfast, as we appreciate guest input. We hope we can provide a perfect visit for you in the future!

review_text: Still a great hotel... nice rooms, great views, friendly staff, convenient location near Metrotown.  Highly recommended
Nice and clean rooms. Very good location in Burnaby close to restaurants and mall. Rooms: Very clean and comfortable.

Friendly staffs. Clean hotel. Beautiful atmosphere inside and outside around that part of the city. Walking distance to everything downtown. Nice comfy rooms, we enjoyed the small pool and hot tubs. We had dinner at the restaurant and the food is good. We will come again!
Beautiful hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Great location. Rooms: Beautiful and clean rooms. Rooms : 5/5 |

We recieved a room upgrade with a separate  bedroom with a king bed and 60 TV ! No complaints here, other than the windows on the room can not be opened to let a little fresh air in. TONS of fine restaurants within 5 min walking distance.  Weird that this Hilton doesnt have valets service like in Downtown Vancouver, but still easy to deal with. Would definitely recommend and would return.
Always enjoy my stay at the Hilton by Metrotown, only thing that could make it better would be an indoor hot tub and sauna.
response_from_owner_text: Thankyou Tyrant, So pleased to have you as a regular with us! Cheers, Michael

review_text: Excellent hotel with heated pool. next to metropolis Mall and skytrain. It has everything you need.
We stayed here pre-COViD and I have all good things to say about the hotel. Very conveniently located, courteous staff and hence, our stay was very pleasant.

You cannot beat the Hilton Metrotown for location and excellent service. it is equidistant between downtown and growing businesses to the east. I have stayed there for the past 10 years with the exception of COVID period: the staff is friendly aware of my needs and will go out of their way to accommodate.

We have had the pleasure to stay here before and love the location for a shopping getaway! Walking distance to Metrotown Mall ! The front desk team and breakfast team were amazing! Even checked with us right after check-in to make sure everything was great! Hope to be back soon!
Very nice property with a convenient location. A SkyLink train station is less than a 10 min walk. The staff were top notch especially Chloe that checked me in. Great views from the hotel also.
Great service, great food, very clean. Would be nice if you cover the pool and hot tub area. Other than that great accommodation.

We had the double queen bed booking with a splendid view of the neighborhood. Free wifi. Overnight parking was $21. Theres a fitness studio on the 3rd floor equipped with treadmills, free weights, and a bench. There are cloth towels, wipes, and a filtered water fountain. Access the Crystal mall from the 2nd floor .

This hotel was LOVELY! The security was really on top of things and made me feel very secure. The rooms were very clean and accomidating. Beds were excellent! Feather duvets are an excellent touch. The front desk attendants were kind, warm and welcoming. It was a lovely stay!

Location wise you cant beach this hotel and hotels around metro town station. I choose this hotel primarily due to higher room cost in Vancouver city this summer. I felt this Hilton hotel provided good value in comparison. And the Vancouver metro system is a very good way to get around for my needs. Although I have to say the car park was a bit confusing at first. Hotel has great rooms. Seems to be new. I liked the room facilities. Everything was great. Breakfast was nice. Service was good but can be iffy when it is super busy. One day I had to wait for coffee for a long time. Would be better if there is self service. The staff are running up and down as it was super busy. Club lounge is small, I dont know how they will be able to deal with the influx of guests when it is fully operational again. Overall a great hotel if you need to be in Vancouver area. Highly recommended.

As a wedding photographer, I had a chance to photograph a few weddings there. I loved the stylish ballroom spaces and an outdoor terrace suitable for outdoor photos. I also enjoyed the catering service.
Stat here because nowhere else had a room great room and service but very pricey

From the time we arrived for our overnight stay the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, they go above and beyond, they accommodated our every need with enthusiasm and made our experience a great pleasure. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the grounds were immaculate and the staff were all professional. I will definitely visit and book without hesitation at another Hilton.

An excellent hotel with an exceptional staff, amazing service and excellent amenities. I want to recognize Neha at the front desk for her wonderful demeanor and abilities to make me feel welcome and important. The breakfast was delicious, good location, nice hot tub. I only wish the pool was bigger and covered.  My favorite hotel in Burnaby!

Stayed here on a Business Trip this week for 4 nights. From the moment I checked in this property exceeded my expectations. The staff and service is exceptional! Liza is a true gem! Rooms felt recently renovated and we re cleaned and tidied daily, I had a 1 King 2 room suite thanks to being a Diamond. I did not experience the Buffet Breakfast as I left for work super early. Liza arranged a bagged breakfast that also exceeded expectations, I cannot be appreciative enough. Executive Lounge is currently opened for Coffee/Espresso Juice/Soft Drinks etc but was told it will be back to the Canape, Breakfast, and Alcohol previous offered soon! Will definitely stay here again
Excellent hotel to stay at.  The staff here were extremely attentive and caring to guests  needs.  Will stay here again!

Everyone here was so friendly.   Our room was upgraded and was a fantastic room!!  The food was great and got to know Steve when we went to the restaurant for evening drinks.  Gave us great ideas on what to do around Vancouver.  We would live to come back to this hotel in the future!!  Thank you for taking such great care of us!!!

I chose this hotel after flight disruptions had me stuck in Vancouver. The service was exceptional and they were readily able to accommodate two extensions as details of the weather disruptions changed. They were kind and helpful and even left a small gift on Christmas morning.

Great stay overall! Warm service, shoutout to Massimo, who was able to quickly resolve a duplicate reservation issue that I found out only a day before I arrived due to an issue with Hiltons (not the hotel itselfs) reservation system. The room was large and clean (although the lamps and the washroom felt a bit dated). The Hilton apps floor plan was very handy as I was able to choose a room with extra floor space with good views thanks to the buildings interesting shape and layout. The digital key also worked well. The location is excellent - an Asian food court is literally downstairs (has an amazing dim sum place) and very close to the SkyTrain station for a ride to downtown. I tried the hotels breakfast once and found it to be pleasant with friendly service from the breakfast room staff, albeit overpriced ($30) compared to similar hotels Ive stayed at so I didnt think it was worth having breakfast there twice. Overall would still highly recommend.

We just attended a dance event here two weeks ago and the venue is great. The staff were incredibly helpful both during the event and front desk in accommodating our needs. Extremely friendly. The location itself is prime as its nearby Metrotown Mall, but just across the street are nice restaurants, coffee shop and Crystal Mall with assortment of Asian cuisine.

The Hilton Vancouver Metrotown and their team are amazing! We had our wedding ceremony  and reception at the Hilton and their attention to detail and working with us was easy, smooth and worry free. From our first interaction with Jackie we knew we had chosen the right venue. She was efficient and very quick getting back to us with email questions and by the end of the wedding and reception we  were even below budget and with her help and assistance our dream wedding came true. The chef and his team out did themselves and the meal selection for our cocktail hour and reception left our guests asking for more! Jackie is a true professional and would highly recommend her and her team. Thank you for making our dream come true. Charlene and Ranj.
Little far from the downtown but just a few steps for metrown mall and subway station. A lot of cafe and good options of a different restaurants so near. Rooms
Nicely situated, great customer service, clean room. Petfriendly its a must for us and our fur babies was Welcome.

Good location, clean rooms , freindly staff specially Massimo who checked me in who was great and Stky Fong and Bing Liu the evening shift who really tried to be accomodating and were very nice. The only proble was that there were no smart tv so you could not connect your phone and stream which I think is a must.   I have amazon prime and netflix which I could not use.   But at othere hotels tgey usually have it.

Our corporate group recently stayed at Hilton Vancouver Metrotown for a business meeting. We occupied over 50 rooms, used their meeting facilities and F&B services. The hotel was lovely, staff was even better, and everything went off without a hitch. Thank you to the HVM team for a well-executed stay.

I was very happy with my stay at the Hilton. The rooms were a good size, with large TV and decent size fridge. One of the key reasons why this hotel does well is its staff, even accommodating my over sized truck by parking it in the loading zone area (for extra fee). With limited parking in the area, this was very beneficial with anyone driving in with large trucks. The breakfast was a step up compared to many other hotels I have stayed at. Coming to the hotel for business, Anthony (one of the managers) made sure my stay met all my needs and expectations, which is why I would recommend this hotel to many of my associates for business stays.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Mohammad! We really appreciate the wonderful feedback and will make sure to share this with Anthony as well. We are so very pleased you enjoyed yourself and that the team took such great care of you. We look forwar to hosting you again soon. Cheers, Michael

review_text: The customer service at this place is exceptional. We arrived close to midnight with no reservation - there was a noisy party upstairs at home, and we just wanted to sleep. They were super friendly and checked us in quickly. The morning desk staff were equally friendly, and the hotel had a complimentary breakfast station set up because the adjoining restaurant is temporarily closed - like, thats going above and beyond. There are plenty of food places in walking distance, but they went out of the way to make things easier for guests. As we were leaving, a smiling custodian warned us about a coffee spill at the bottom of the escalator so we wouldnt step in it. Right down to the very last person we had contact with as we left, everyone was at that high level of customer care. I mean the rooms are great, but I needed to call out the awesome staff!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Pam, Thank you so much for your kind words with the interactions you had with our team members during your stay with us. I am glad to read that everyone took great care of you and look forward to welcoming you back soon. Chris

review_text: We stayed for 9 nights, uppon arrival we had a chat with the striking workers who were not realy friendly. Hotel staff took care of the problem and were realy helpful during the whole stay. We would have loved to get the breakfast buffet but the grab and go breakfast was just fine, infact our kids loved it. The room was clean and staff gave us new towels uppon request. I would recommend this hotel.
The hotel staff were so kind and welcoming. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and wish it couldve been for longer. Everything was excellent. If we come back to Metro, well be back at this Hilton.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Chris for the feedback. Look forward to welcoming you back very soon.

review_text: The staff at Hilton Metrotown went above and beyond for me at every opportunity. The rooms were flawlessly clean and comfortable. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Thank you to the staff, especially Steve and Elaine, for the absolute best service I have ever encountered in a hotel.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Liisa! We are so pleased you had such a wonderful experience with us!  We truly appreciate your comments and will make sure to share your praises with Elaine and Steve! Thanks again and we look forward to hosting you soon. Cheers, Michael

review_text: I spent a lovely evening at this hotel. The hotels basic accommodations were fine -- clean, comfortable, what youd expect. The staff, on the other hand, were outstanding. Ive never been to a hotel where so many people seemed to be in such a consistent good mood. Everybody took the time to chat with my young son, everybody seemed happy to help out. Whatever the management is doing at this hotel, keep it up. You have an excellent staff.

A wonderful place to stay. The front desk people were always friendly and amazing. When we first arrived, our room smelt a little off, we called down to the desk and  they moved us to a new room that smelt clean! They even came up to our floor and helped us move over. My only complaint, and this might be because I am not a resident of Vancouver. I dont think you should charge your guests for parking. Work it into your room prices or something. An extra $20 to park my car a night, was a little bit of a drag. Other hotels in your area supply free parking. Perhaps something to think about. Thank you again for the amazing stay though!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you U iBbi for your great comments! We are pleased you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate your comments regarding the parking and we will review with our leadership team. We look forward to hosting you again soon. Cheers, Michael

review_text: I stay at the Hilton Metrotown every week for work. The staff are amazing, and the rooms are large and spotless. Breakfast has lots of options. I have stayed in many of the rooms, all have excellent views of the city. Will be back next week!
response_from_owner_text: Thanks Jayme s! We truly appreciate your comments and look forward to seeing you again soon! Safe travels, Michael

review_text: Decent rooms,  deep bath tub. Helpful and friendly staff.  Excellent location. Strange that the cold water taps had hot water running through it. Once you run cold water tap for a while, it does eventually  get cold.

Stayed here for a night. Staff were very warm and welcoming! Super helpful too! I arrived early and they allowed an early check-in which I appreciated! The hotel is well-maintained and clean. The indoor gym is very nice and my room was very clean!
response_from_owner_text: Hello Cindy, Happy to hear you enjoyed your stay!  And wanted to let you know that if you liked our rooms now, wait until we are done our room refresh!  Hopefully you are able to return and enjoy them again. Cheers, Michael Director of Operations

review_text: At last!  A hotel that actually understands what it is selling.  Sleep. The room was dimly lit in general which is my fave.  The curtains covered the ENTIRE window and they even overlapped the tracks in the centre so not one annoying laser of light came through in the morning.  The door was placed around a corner so no sneaky hallway light either. No noise from the street.  None.  (In freakin METROTOWN!) The beds were perfect, the pillows a tad on the soft side for me as a side sleeper, but they worked. I have insomnia and chronic neck and shoulder pain.  I woke up rested and with a happy body. Sure, I could nitpick some other things about the hotel, but if like me actually sleeping is your #1 priority, this is the place.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks Angela! So glad to hear you enjoyed your rest and look forward to hosting you again soon. Cheers, Michael

review_text: Very good stay over Labour Day week and weekend for soccer and to move one of the kids down to UBC.  The hotel is well situated close to the Metrotown mall and a couple of  grocery stores, and was clean and quiet.  Staff were extremely helpful assisting with parking our U Haul trailer.  Hotel is experiencing a labour dispute so housekeeping and catering services were curtailed but good instructions provided for that.  We would stay there again.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Mr. Hardy Thank you for your comments and for your support and understanding during this time. I am glad to read that you and your family had a positive experience with us and look forward to welcoming you back soon. Take care. Chris Chris Perna General Manager

review_text: Room was clean and comfortable. Loved the light up magnifying make up mirror. Housekeeping staff were fantastic!

The Guest service is the best. Leanora (might have spell wrongly), she was really nice. Hilton is lucky to have her. She is so kind and polite. Because of her service, I am going to recommend all our business associates to come to this hotel. Very modern and luxurious room.
response_from_owner_text: Hello Ms. Ho, Thank you so much for letting us know how Leonora  took such good care of your while you were staying with us!  We agree that we are fortunate to have her as part of our team and will share your comments with her. Cheers, Michael

review_text: Excellent! I visit this hotel on regular basis. The rooms are spacious and clean, staff are very helpful and kind, the food is wonderful. We attended a wedding ceremony and reception recently, it was excellent. I cant think of anything that wasnt good. The atmosphere, the food, staff, parking... Everything was top. Great job Hilton Metrotown, Thank you!
response_from_owner_text: Hello youare2001na, Thank you very much for your great comments!  We are so pleased you enjoyed yourself at the event and continue to visit us again and again! We look forward to seeing you again soon! Cheers, Michael Director of Operations

review_text: Excellent front end staff, very helpful service. The room was very nice and clean. Theres a rooftop pool and jacuzzi as well as a gym. We only stayed for one night so we didnt get to use any of the facilities but overall its a very nice hotel.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Tina, Thank you for taking the time to share your great comments from your recent visit and we are pleased that you enjoyed yourself!  Hopefully you can return soon to enjoy more of the property. Cheers, Michael

review_text: Excellent/Exceptional front desk service from the time Stephanie helped me with my reservations (she took her time to answer all my questions so that I can decide to stay with them), to the time I checked in. They were so kind to have accommodated to all my requests. All the staff including the housekeeping crew was super nice. They made me feel at home and always greeted my family with smiles. Everyone was great, I also want to thank Steve, Arif, Ben, Michael and Stephanie whom I gotten to meet. Great location. Great underground parking, very clean hotel. Pool was heated, the kids had a blast. The beds were super comfy and so was the queen sized sofa bed (quite surprising). Thank you, will sure to return in the future. Btw thank you for the welcome letter addresses to my kids, they were so happy!
response_from_owner_text: Hello Wendy! Thank you so much for the wonderful feedback and I will make sure to share with the team.  We are so very pleased you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to hosting you again! Please do not hesitate to reach out directly if you need anything else at Michael.favelle@hilton.com. You guys were a treat for us as well! Cheers, Michael

review_text: Friendly staff, clean rooms, lovely outdoor hot tub! Super close to SkyTrain which made it worth every dollar spent!
amazing view and room. it was well cleaned, The digital key to access the room is a very good idea. The front desk staff is helpful and welcoming.

My review is a bit late but nevertheless here it is. My family and I have been staying at the Hilton metro town loyally since 2013. I started school at BCIT nearby. In that time we have gotten to know Stephanie and she is such a wonderful person. My father has stayed here as well on business other times and he always raves about the service and friendliness of everyone. Now it is February 2021 We arrived and needed a room. I can t remember her name (it started with a A). But she checked us in very quickly and efficiently. We were also given a room higher up with a view which was amazing. I asked for Stephanie and was told she was working tomorrow. The next morning we were delighted to have a COVID free breakfast and coffees. Thank you so much. Our purpose for this hotel stay was to purchase a vehicle. So that day we went out and bought a   SUV. As we were from out of town, we stayed another night. I got to talk to Stephanie that afternoon which was so nice, and we were given parking additionally for our new SUV which was great. What happened next was incredible.. We had bought a new set of winter tires and rims which were currently sitting inside our new vehicle in the underground parking. At about 10pm our phone in our hotel room rang and it was security. They were concerned for our new SUV and tires and they offered the loading locked garage to park it in for the night. I was happy to hear that they were watching out for us and so I went downstairs and moved our suv. This is something that was above and beyond what we asked for and it was incredible. Also to note that our room was extremely clean and we felt safe during our stay during this pandemic. That was very important to us. I can t rave enough about the Hilton metro town and thank you again for a wonderful stay. See you soon again hopefully!!!
response_from_owner_text: Hello Taylor, Thank you so much for taking the time to share your wonderful comments with us!  We are so pleased you enjoy staying with us and that the team took great care of you. We are very proud and fortunate to have such dedicated and caring people with us.  We have made sure to share your comments with them. Thank you again and we look forward to hosting you soon. Cheers, Michael

review_text: We stayed at the Hilton hotel Burnaby for 2 nights and man we were blown away by the customer service. Anthony at the front desk was such an amazing part of our stay. When the wifi didnt work in our room, he upgraded us to a suite down the hall from our original room. The staff were very friendly, and brought us what we needed whether it be a blanket, cutlery or mouthwash! The hotel is also just a walk away from Metrotown if you are into shopping!

The  hotel house party idea first through us off, we are not party types and were concerned of the noise. We stayed on the 2nd floor and did not hear any noise during our stay related to the party. Decorated with some goofiness In mind its a very inviting space. Plenty to see and the food was delicious. The room itself was delightful, the design motif from the rest of the hotel continues into these rooms.  The no diving shower was a fun addition. Since no place is truly perfect I need to find something to put into a negative. That would be room size, we stayed in a double twin bed room and found it to be on the small side. Nothing to prevent any further desire to stay here and not something that should put off any potential other guests! Thank you Hotel Belmont staff for an amazing stay

There are coffee shops, 7/11 convenience store, clubs, restos and bars. Walking distance to Hornby, Granville, Yaletown, Robson. Everything is so walkable that you dont even need to take a taxi/Uber, the amount of time & money you are saving. Before I stayed at this hotel, I was skeptical since so many Google reviews mentioned how noisy the streets and the areas are that they couldnt sleep. Occasionally, there are noise from outside but they are manageable and within reason. I was ok with it and had good sleeps. Listen, lets be rational and be reasonable here, you are staying in the entertainment/clubbing district, and you are complaining about excessive noise? You must be kidding me here. Name me a place around the world where you stay close to bars and clubs and you expect to hear nothing but crickets? I am just being realistic and being reasonable here. I found the hotel inside itself very quiet and calm, I had a good night sleep. What I look for when I stay at this hotel is its prime location that is close to everything.

Were proud to have our own Aquaman at the front desk, ensuring that every guest receives superhero-level service. Its always our goal to make each stay memorable, and were delighted to know we hit the mark with you. Hotel Belmont Vancouver MGallery

review_text: We booked this hotel before our Alaska cruise. The decor is eclectic and funky. The front desk staff are very friendly and it is super clean. Our room was modern. The bed, bedding and pillows were awesome. The funky decor extends to the room which had a fridge with the door resembling a guitar amplifier. The only downside is there are steps to enter from the street. I would return the next time I am in Vancouver.

They take us after our flight got cancel. Everyone was really welcoming, they take care of us very well. The hotel is really beautiful, room are clean and confortable. A really nice discovery! Beautiful place if you want to be in the action of the city! Thanks you very much to Simon and his staff! We will come back for sure!

This hotel is wonderful! Super friendly and helpful staff.  Very clean rooms.  Neighborhood seems a little iffy, but tons of walkable restaurants, bars and entertainment . Rooms are very quiet despite the club and people on the street below.

Located very central, a lot of areas like Gastown, Chinatown etc can be reached by 15-20 min walk. Not the cheapest hotel, also not the most modern one, but good in general, nice staff, breakfast was good, nice bar. Neighborhood is ok, parking lot has to be paid but thats normal for any hotel. All in all a good experience for us. Rooms are a little bit small, no fridge inside, but still fine. Bed also a little bit small, but acceptable. Room walls are a little bit thin, but still acceptable. Pricing could be a little bit lower
We took a girls trip for the weekend, and Ava was absolutely the best bartender I have ever had. She made our stay 100x better. Plus she was hot. Definitely recommend coming here!

Stayed a night here and I was pleasantly surprised at the charm of this Hotel. It is located in the heart of the city, and many great food options are within walking distance. If you fancy some adventure, you are only a short distance from many historic sites with lots of opportunities to learn more about the culture of the city. The hotel itself also has an arcade in the basement and a secure/safe lobby with internet/computer access. The room we stayed in was very well kept, clean, and comfortable. This room featured a king size bed, which was perfect, and a cheeky shower that stated there was to be No Diving. All in all it was a great experience, and Id definitely do it again!

Perfect location to walk around downtown. Hotel staffs were friendly and welcoming. Room was lovely and comfortable,  loved the showers in the room. Room came with 15% discount for Room service from the living room restaurant. Overnight parking available by the street which is around $23++ per night. Overall lovely stay and not everyday you will bump into a superhero while walking around the city.

Love how the owners updated this hotel. Its cute on the outside as well as inside. Cool vibe and hip room. Super clean. The walls are thick and little noise gets through which as great for a light sleeper like me. I like the Keurig coffee maker and the drink options in my room. Jeff and Claudio gave me above and beyond great customer service. For the price point, quality and how centrally located this hotel is...I highly recommend it. The restaurant downstairs has yummy options and you are also surrounded by many other restaurants in the area. Its also safe walking around this neighbourhood. As a female who weighs just over 100lbs...I felt safe:)
Amin is very helpful and friendly. Great location, clean room, and convenient parking lot.
Centrally located to various attractions. Booked through Expedia. Nearby activities: Museum, Granville Island, Parq Casino and good eateries close by, ex: Nero s and Templeton. Rooms : 5/5 |
response_from_owner_text: Dear L, Thank you for the wonderful review! Were thrilled you found our location convenient for exploring various attractions. Booking directly with us offers added benefits and exclusive perks, ensuring an even more delightful stay. Wed love to host you again and provide you with additional incentives when you book directly. Looking forward to your next visit! Hotel Belmont Vancouver MGallery

review_text: I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel isn t new, but very nicely renovated. Very modern. Specially liked bathroom design and Marshall mini bar fridge. Bathroom amenities...shampoo, conditioner, gel  one of the best I ever seen in the hotels. Can t recall the brand, but it has mint flavour...very refreshing. Pillows and mattress super comfy as well. I don t remember when was the last time I slept so deeply. They have great restaurant downstairs as well. The only disadvantage it might be, on Saturday night this street gets really loud with clubs and restaurants. Staff was amazing.

When it comes to hospitality, cleanliness and professional staff 5 stars isnt enough. We stayed for 6 nights and above and beyond to the best of their abilities is an accurate description of this hotel. The room size was fair considering their definite competitive price and the modern shower was top notch. I personally would of liked a mini fridge in the room but given half of the vancover experience is food and drink we ended up not necessarily needing one. The bar theyre connected to turns into a nightclub essentially on the weekend so if youre planning on staying over the weekend I would suggest a room 2nd floor or higher, we were situated on the 2nd floor and we have no complaints. And In my opinion a family stay would be better off outside of downtown vancover to begin with. This is a great place we would recommend and we will stay again
Almost all staff was super helpful and very nice. Good location. Can roam the street up and down for hours. Tattoo shops surround it.

Was at this hotel for 2 nights. Great location as its close to the various bars and nightclubs on Granville St. Room was small but the beds were super comfortable and the washrooms had umlimited amounts of soap and shampoo. The price was also affordable as well. Enjoyed my stay here. Also had a good time at the bar below.

The rooms are cozy, a little small but thats fine since youre gonna be out most of the day. The interiors are sooo beautiful! Theyre also really clean which is very very important. Check-ins and check-outs are contactless- their new protocol because of covid. The location is right in the heart of Granville St, which means it can get loud when your windows are open but otherwise it feels like an oasis when theyre shut. You wouldnt even know how crazy loud it is down there if you didnt look out the window. They also have an amazing bar. The renovations in this building from what it was before is totally jaw-dropping! If you drive and need to park your car, there is a fee of $30/night. So thats something to also really think about since it racks up the price per room. We ended up finding another parking space thats cheaper.

Ava made my experience and my first time to Canada one to remember very welcoming, inviting informative and added to the whole vibe of the restaurant will definitely be back. And knowing that her favorite color is yellow is amazing.

beautiful interior decor, i wish the hotel i worked at, was updated like this, we could really use some help lol, all safe was helpful as a former housekeeper of 9yrs it was all very clean.. will def stay again, hoping for our birthdays in december

Great boutique style hotel on the main strip. Nice bar downstairs with just-right service and ambiance. I was staying on business and it was just great. Room is perfect size with amenities. I would add a few plugs at the desk but definitely not a deal killer. Deco is really nice too.
Perfect place for downtown Vancouver. Close to everything. You will not be disappointed here.

I realize that the reviews on this hotel are mixed, but the hotel is pretty good. Though slightly small, the rooms are very modern. There are also plenty of power outlets. The toiletries are of high quality. This is one of those hotels that surprises you. Its not a luxury 5-star hotel, but its better than you would expect. I recommend it.

Have stayed here twice, both times great experience. Recently renovated, modern interior and clean rooms. Would stay again. Easy check in / check out and as the rooms are slightly smaller than a typical hotel room it is also cheaper for the great central location.

Its a great clean hotel, spacious and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and helpful. You have to pay for parking but they make a plan to accommodate you. WiFi is free and unlimited, does not seem to have issues connecting. The beds are really comfortable, TV is a big flat screen. Free TV and coffee facilities in the lobby. The location is great, very central. Overall an excellent hotel to stay at, would definitely come back.

Had a great stay here just before new years. Staff was very helpful at the front and very pleasant. Decor was vibrant throughout the hotel. Great location nearby many restaurants and bars in the heart of downtown. Rooms are smaller than usual but its not tight inside of the room and you are given more than enough space. Great place to spend the night in downtown Vancouver. Highly recommend.

Chic boutique hotel with beautiful decor. Clean rooms and exceptional friendly service. Beds were super comfortable and the body and hair wash products provided were great! Located in the heart of entertainment district, so generally a very young crowd around the hotel. Bonus that guests are able to go into Living Room and Basement [bar/club] through the hotel! Our room was on the 5th floor and was super quiet. Cons: - The breakfast buffet offered at $15 pp is basically just cereal, ham and coffee. - Key card needed to get into hotel after hours, which is great, but the doors stay open way too long allowing people to come in some time after you [and they did] - not the greatest area to have this happen

Stayed here for 10 days and we loved everything. Absolute value for money and the best you can get in this price range. Modern, chic boutique hotel with  every detail carefully thought through from the shampoo to the shower to makeup remover wipes. Coffee machine was also great. Staff is extremely friendly

Accessible from sky train, surrounded with many restaurants and even small convenient stores. We got a big room with 2 queen size bed and a pull out couch. Looks and feels clean. Bathroom is decent size but very updated. Decor is modern.

Excellent customer service, very clean room, I asked for an electric kettle which the hotel ordered. Security is very good and things like in room safe deposit and the availability of Google Chromecast devices where you can stream your own programs to the tv is very well thought. Also the presence of an electronic information pad is unique and very welcoming. Overall : very pleased

Great location. Within walking distance to alot of places. Stayed here for 2 nights and the staff are all friendly. We got discount coupons for the aquarium from the front desk which was pretty cool. The buffet breakfast is pretty decent as well. Would definitely stay here again.

Nice boutique hotel and reasonably priced compare to other Accor hotels in Vancouver.  Rooms are very clean and well appointed.  The Living Room is the perfect vibe to chill with my friends in town.  Will visit again soon.

I stay at Hotel Belmont every time I am in Vancouver and I can t get enough! It is so so wonderfully renovated - the room and the washroom are so chic and modern - I am obsessed! It s always up to the highest of standards, super clean, and the staff are very friendly! I ve always had such an incredible experience! Definitely recommend 100% to everyone :)

My dad and I had an excellent stay at the Comfort Inn downtown. The location cannot be beat. Parking is perfect alongside the building, cheap for this city at $14/night, and self-park in/out. The room was clean, simple, and small, but it had comfortable beds and a nice view of the city by night. We needed a place for a hot shower, a good nights sleep, and a chance to catch the evening news. Breakfast is free through the hotels pub and is filling and complete. I had seen many reviews about small rooms, loudness, or bed bugs, and decided to take a gamble. I found all of that to be unfounded with the exception of the rooms being small. If you are really going on vacation to see the city though, they have plenty of space to set down a suitcase, write a letter/postcard at your desk and store souvenirs. The value was unbeatable and the staff exceptionally friendly. This was our first stay, and it does appear that they have renovated the whole place in the last year or two.

Had a nice dinner in this hotels restaurant, The Living Room. Quickly received complimentary beverage and snack after seated down for a short while. Standard masking and social distancing protocols were following accordingly based on the health orders Love the setting of the place, I couldnt stop looking around at the decor Menu via QR code, the drinks were interesting and the foods were great. Cozy and comfortable place to hang out with friends or date for a meal or snacks.

Never been to Canada before but the bartender at the living room, Ava, made me want to come back all the time! She was the best bartender i ve ever had and made our trip better than i could ve imagined, would definitely recommend coming to see her here!
I had a great experience and hope to come back.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Elizabeth, Thank you for the wonderful review! Were thrilled to hear about your great experience. We cant wait to welcome you back for another fantastic stay! Hotel Belmont Vancouver MGallery

review_text: The location of the place is perfect, it is close to everything. The staff were very friendly and the room was great. We would book a room here again in the future.

Cant beat the location, booked months in advance. Irish pub is connected to the hotel, breakfast was included in our rate. It was good  and constantly replenished. 402 and 502 were quiet rooms. Staff was very accommodating and professional. Tea, coffee,water, in lobby is a nice touch. Beds were comfortable and room was clean. Main strips all around, with main strip issues. Cabbies ripped us off, only go by what the meter says, dont fall for the short trip charge
We were sent to Hotel Belmont after our flight was delayed and the service was excellent, rooms were a good size, very clean and stylish. We had a short but great stay!

Room was nice and clean, although the view left a lot to be desired. Staff were friendly and helpful. Was very impressed by their honesty when wed left $100 in our room when we checked out and they held it at the front desk for us. We will stay there again for sure.

Honestly, I ve only ever stayed at one hotel that really stood out to me. This is now makes for number two. Hotel Belmont is a stand out for sure. What an outstanding place to stay. It s in a prime location, the vibes are unreal and the check in staff are delightful. The room was beyond anything I could have hoped for. The furniture was fun and funky. It really does have the coolest all around look and feel. We spent the evening at The Livingroom and The Basement. I now found my favourite places to enjoy a night downtown. What a great experience. I 100% recommended Hotel Belmont to anyone who is considering it. You will not regret it! ...I also had the best sleep of my life! I am in love with the comfy bed and I am still dreaming about the pillows!
Good service and very nice room. Their shower is one of the most beautiful places I ve ever seen.

Very Nice place to stay , welcoming staff and great room service. We were a group of three and got 2 bed and sofa bed , comfortable pillow. Like the Kurag coffee machine with extra flavor they give you, Clean and fresh towels, like No diving sign in the washroom and the soap dispenser or something else. Definitely will go again if visiting Vancouver

Friendly staff, very helpful. Room was great and we got a complimentary upgrade as well. Very clean and great amenities. Small elevator so we had to take 2 trips with our stroller and bags but it was fine.

We had a lovely stay, everything was perfect! We chose Belmont because it looked like the most modern hotel in Vancouver downtown, way above the other ones that are 4 and 5 stars but look like they havent renovated since the nineties.

Stayed for 3 nights on my own for a mini getaway. Really nice hotel with a funky vibe, definitely seems to be catered more towards a younger crowd. The hotel was very clean from what I saw. Since it was just myself, I got one of the cheaper rooms with one bed, cable TV, a mini fridge (a really cool looking one, might I add), a Keurig, amongst other complimentary items. Pretty much right in the heart of downtown, can easily get to anywhere in Vancouver fairly quickly by either walking or catching a bus/skytrain. I don t drive and so I spent most of my time walking around, finding new places to eat, and hanging out in the nearby parks/waterfronts. Overall, was a really enjoyable experience! I would definitely go stay there again. Best part is that they have room service, and two restaurants downstairs of the hotel for days you don t want to leave (which is much appreciated on rainy days) plus computers you can use in the lobby and arcade games

I really enjoyed the stay here and I was exited, nice hotel nice rooms design crazy cool, good and great price! Location is the only thing I was mmm... Doubt about it but if you are careful you can enjoy it as we did!! The mint soap shampoo and conditioner is the Thing we loved it!!

The guest services guide on the tablet is the lovely icing on the cake. And the included Chromecast that works when youre connected to the hotel wifi. The cake? Best Cake ever. Not bland or generic. Loaded right up with quirky uniqueness and personality Ive not seen elsewhere. Frankly, this is the way a hotel should be.
Beautiful decor and super comfy beds. Our room was right on Granville, but generally very quiet. I strongly recommend staying here.

I was pleasantly surprised by our stay at the Comfort Inn. The area is central to the Granville hub where we were seeing a concert. It is a slightly dicey location unless you enjoy humanity at its worst. Regardless, the hotel contrasted the area. I was expecting a shabby run down hotel. The lobby is right next to Doolans pub which has happy hour $5 craft beer until 6pm. This worked out well. The elevator was out of service during our visit but the stairs helped burn off some beer calories and we got a great rate. I was worried about street noise. Again, no problem. We had a king bed in our room and selection of firm and soft pillows. It was amazingly comfortable. Probably the best hotel sleep I can recall. In this price range for the area of downtown, it would be very hard to beat. Parking is extra and breakfast is over priced, but the Wifi is free. There are dozens of breakfast options nearby and the parking rate is fair for the area. Staff were courteous and the hotel was well kept. Our bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and recent Reno. Very impressed with the value.

Wonderful hotel. Hidden gem in Granville street. Excellent location at an affordable price. Less than 2 blocks away from the Canada Line station. Very convenient if youre coming from the airport. Rooms were nice, beds comfy and the washroom was spotless. Try to book a room with breakfast included. It was a really good breakfast, which was served in the Irish pub thats next to the hotel (both places are connected by inside, so its not necessary to leave the building).

Well appointed, very modern rooms with all the little comforts to help you relax. Very stylish decor with great in room appointments. Not sure what else you would need since you should be spending your time outside in lovely Vancouver.
Enjoyed my stay here! Modern, clean hotel. Rooms are slightly small but are definitely comfortable and clean! Staff was friendly and very helpful. Would stay here again and recommend it!
Good pub/restaurant offering wide selection of food and drink. Hotel is staffed by super friendly knowledgeable staff who seem eager to assist. Reasonably priced rooms, of a good size.

Absolutely fantastic. Well worth the cost. Lovely air conditioned rooms. Tons of amenities. Fantastic breakfast in the morning for $10 extra. And a free drink voucher to boot. Coffee and tea maker, large wall mounted flatscreen tv with plenty of channels. Huge amount of space in the room.

Not the place for a quiet night but great location! Steps from Granville and busy nightclubs. My room had a comfortable king sized bed and a jet soaker tub in the updated bathroom. Would definitely stay there again if attending a concert or event.

Not much to look at from the outside, but inside is a different story! Weve stayed here several times and havent been disappointed. I recommend staying in a corner room. They are bigger and have jacuzzi tubs if you like that kind of thing. The location is great and centrally located downtown. Loved the atmosphere at Doolins Irish Pub, which is attached. Also, had a great time at the Belmont downstairs. We will definitely stay here whenever we come to Vancouver!

Excellent location.  Room was nice & the bar/restaurant was very good Nearby activities: Vogue theater, where our concet was at, was only a block away Walkability: Walked to concert at Vogue Theater Food & drinks: The restaurant & bar in the hotel was very good

My partner booked a surprise birthday staycation at the Hotel Belmont. We were upgraded upon arrival, and the room was fantastic. Very clean and comfortable. The shower was incredible. Cant wait to visit again.

A great pub that provides free breakfast buffet when staying at the comfort inn. It also provides a free drink during certain hours and the night life gets better. The food and beer selection were great, I recommend the wings, braised beef poutine and nachos. The service is great too and a convenient location for night life in the heart of downtown.
Very beautiful and neat superb restaurant food very good..
Price location and staff were great. The Belmont is an old downtown hotel but all the rooms have had a major upgrade. The bar downstairs is fun as well. Would stay again and recommend for sure.

This was one of the best hotel stays in the last 5 years I been travelling, my other hotel reservation got cancelled so this was my last choice. Sam got me a room that I was looking for(I am a picky guy) in under 10 mins, parking spot took her only 2 min to aquire, and she was extremely friendly and helpful. I would say this hotel has the best customer satisfaction that Ive seen in a while. Thanks Comfort Inn !

Very friendly staff to check us in. Offered an array of recommendations and suggestions for visitors. Perfect location in the center of downtown. Well within walking distance from Stanley Park! Small rooms, but efficiently organized. A seagull greeted us in our window upon morning, which was a fun touch! Windows open up for city views and sounds. It was surprisingly fairly sounds proof from street noise, even on the 2nd story.
Excellent stay. Staff very friendly. I stayed in this hotel chain in New York a couple yrs ago and very similar set up. Smaller rooms but they make up for it with service and decor.
AMAZING, CLEAN AND VERY COMPETENT STAFF. The location was awesome, front desk was really accommodating and parking was right by the hotel. Would absolutely recommend this hotel.

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: I was impressed with the hotel from the moment I entered the door. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The little touches left in my room as a welcome made me feel like my business was appreciated. A nice breakfast brunch was included in the stay which was a nice addition.  The only criticism Id give was the room was marketed as top floor city view and my window literally looked out onto the roof. Not much of a city view however the room itself was quite nice. Lots of great amenities near by including a very large shopping mall and the metro station. Nearby activities: Many restaurants and shopping. Safety: Doors are locked to the hotel at all times.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Michelle Grodecki, Thank you for choosing us, we appreciate your positive feedback about we did to welcome you and our staff, we are always trying to do our best to deliver a good experience for you and also glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us due to it! We hope your next stay is just around the corner, looking forward to welcoming you back soon Michelle Grodecki. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: Reading those past reviews of unhappy customers makes me think they were in the wrong hotel. My family and I booked a room but at the last minute had unexpected guests coming with us. Brandon at the front desk was very pleasant to remind the hotel policy  that we cant be all in the same room. He offered we get another room at the lowest discounted price he could give us. I also got the first room with the extra pillows as I requested weeks ahead. Holiday Inn is the best property for me!
response_from_owner_text: Dear Tina Dolor, We really appreciate the time dedicated and thank you for all the feedback and comments on your last stay. Great to hear that you found our staff friendly and helpful and now we know that we are not the only ones who loves Brandon. He is so nice, right? We are glad to hear that we could make such as good experience for you and you enjoy your stay as a result. We look forward to your next visit Tina Dolor. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: Looks recently renovated so it s clean and modern. Super friendly people at the front desk, housekeeping and breakfast area on the second floor. Quick note on the light switches, there s one in the room that s really hard to find and it controls the lighting above the bed - see the uploaded picture for a tiny black switch next to the wall power outlets. Free parking underground is great and easy to access using the hotel elevators. If you get there late evening, you will need your hotel key card to open the gates. It s also part of a shopping mall so you have access to lots of food options. Looking forward to a return trip!
response_from_owner_text: Dear Francis S, Thank you for all the feedback and comments on your recent stay. Great to hear that you were able to get around easily, you found our staff friendly and helpful and you enjoyed your stay very much. We look forward to your next visit Francis S. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: This is one of the best Holiday Inns in Canada, with a central location, fantastic staff (Anja is a superstar!), safe underground parking and a great open space pool. Breakfast is decent too, and the kitchen staff is also amazing, especially considering how difficult it is to please everyone during breakfast time when the hotel is the busiest. Walkability: Short walk to shopping centre and metro town sky train station.

We are glad to hear that we could make such as good experience for you and you enjoy your stay as a result. We look forward to your next visit Ivan Veljkovic. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: Holiday Inn Express has come a long way from the first one I stayed in many years ago. Room was large, quiet and king size bed was very comfortable. Breakfast choice was expansive and very tasty. LRT station is across the street with easy access and large mall is all around. If you are coming to Burnaby this is the place to stay.
response_from_owner_text: Dear BIll McN, Thank you for all the feedback and comments on your recent stay. Great to hear that you were able to get around easily, you found our staff friendly and helpful and you enjoyed your stay very much. We look forward to your next visit BIll McN. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: We liked it a lot, very friendly & accomodating staff, we stayed there for a few days to visit Vancouver and its surroundings. The pool is small but its pretty neat to be in the middle of metrotown. And the sky train is litteral accross the street. The price wasnt OK though, we booked kinda last minute but it was a little too expensive nevertheless...
response_from_owner_text: Dear Boris, Thank you for choosing us, we appreciate your positive feedback about our staff, we are always trying to do our best to deliver a good experience for you and also glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us due to it! We hope your next stay is just around the corner, looking forward to welcoming you back soon Boris. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: Reminds me very much of the hotels in Tokyo, very central and close to everything you could ever want or need as a traveler. Every ethnic type of food is a few minutes walk, rapid transit outside the front door, breakfast included (really good selection), very walkable with a massive city park within blocks, no need to drive for anything Rooms: Clean and quiet depending on the side of the hotel you are on since one side faces the elevated rail line transit station. Train traffic is constant and does produce considerable noise for some people Nearby activities: Central park has a rubberized soft surface trail around most of its circumference making it idea for running, many trails for cycling. Swimming pool in hotel. Safety: Very central location, lots of street lighting, lots of people about, friendly people about, low volume of homelessness visible Walkability: 10 minutes walk to Central Park (220 acres of forest, ponds, mini golf, trails, kids park) 2 minutes walk to over 300 stores in Metrotown Mall 1 - 5 minutes will get you to at least 50 restaurants Food & drinks: The whole area is very Asian food centric, however you can get great Italian (Trattoria Burnaby) Westcoast (Earls, Cactus Club)
response_from_owner_text: Dear Warrant, Thank you for your comment on your last stay. Great to hear that you enjoyed your stay very much, we really like the location as well. We look forward to your next visit Warrant. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: Awesome hospitality Really nice rooms , I booked non smoking Very good staff, Good complementary breakfast, no need to go out for breakfast. Perfect location.... I rented car but you dont have to ... Skytrain and bus service are  just across the street. Buy daily pass and njoy any public ride for $11 a day. Highly recommend this place for family vacation.

Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: Very clean and great service. Breakfast is nice. Location is perfect right at the mall. Everything is nearby
response_from_owner_text: Dear Neil Sharma, Thank you for your comment on your last stay. Great to hear that you like our cleaning standards, breakfast and you enjoyed your stay very much, we really like the location as well. We look forward to your next visit Neil Sharma. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: One of the best ihg hotel experiences Ive had so far. Arrived at around 1 am due to our over delayed flight with two crying toddlers. The man checking us in was helpful and patient,  gave extra snacks - if youve ever traveled with kids, you know snacks are are king. Room was clean and had good amount of room, shower had good pressure. Location was handy, its right across the street from the skytrain (half hour train ride to CBD). Located as apart of the metro mall, right next to the crystal mall. Tim Hortons and starbucks right at entrance. Great complimentary breakfast, well staffed and good amount of room. I would definitely stay here again and reccomend it.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Irene, Thank you for all the feedback and comments on your recent stay. Great to hear that you were able to get around easily, you found our staff friendly and helpful and you enjoyed your stay very much. We look forward to your next visit Irene. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: This hotel is close to metrotown and sky train. We enjoyed our stay here, staff were friendly and accomodating especially Michelle. Also breakfast kitchen staffs were efficient, friendly and helpful.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Lovelle Jamaca, We really appreciate the time dedicated by and thank you for all the feedback and comments on your last stay. Great to hear that you found our staff friendly and helpful and now we know that we are not the only ones who loves Michelle. She is so nice, right? We are glad to hear that we could make such as good experience for you and you enjoy your stay as a result. We look forward to your next visit Lovelle Jamaca. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: This is a 2 Star hotel, but Id rate it a 3+. Large, clean rooms, great water pressure in shower, quiet interior, lots of helpful staff, good security, free breakfasts, perfect location, well stocked gym, and very accessible to restaurants and stores. Will definitely be staying here again.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Susan Rabb, Thank you for your comment on your last stay. Great to hear that you had an exceptional service, amenity and our staff made a great impression for you. We look forward to your next visit Susan Rabb. Scott J General Manager

place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: I stayed at the hotel for four nights and absolutely loved it! It was conveniently located near everything in Metrotown, and the staff were incredibly friendly. place_name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver-Metrotown (Burnaby), an IHG Hotel
review_text: I cant speak for the other reviewers but one of those reviews is so far fetched and exaggerated that I am having a hard time understanding the disconnect in service. I travel weekly for Business, for the next 3 months I am in Vancouver visiting different clients within BC. I am an IHG member and have stayed in almost every property in BC. That being said, I had a great experiences at every location, but I had a superb experience at the Metro-town location. I arrived in the afternoon cranky, Lisa at the front desk didnt break a sweat, even with the pending 3rd party approval she promptly got me into a room. Upon opening the door to my room, I was greeted with the lingering stench of a smoker. A quick phone to the front desk and I found myself upgraded to the only available room left, the Executive Level. Needless to say, I was more than obliged. The hotel offers all the same amenities of Holiday Inn Suburbia Express at a convenient downtown location. The hotel is practically adjacent to the Metrotown Center and offers free valet parking, high speed internet access, and complimentary breakfast. That being said, there are a few areas of improvement: - Executive rooms should have wireless routers in the room, moving past the bed became an internet dead zone for wireless access. - The Danby refrigerators are loud: I wasnt sure if mine was on the way out, but I have noticed this problem in many other Holiday Inns as well. - Not a fan of the food choices for the continental breakfast, not a fan of free processed breakfast in general. - This is 2013, would it hurt to modernize the business areas or bedside tables with USB ports or radios to plug our USB smart phones into? I typically find most plugs are eaten up by Clunky hotel fixtures and why are desks so high but the Task chairs are like reverse booster chairs? (Also a problem in most hotels) All in all, I was very happy with this location and I am planning on staying here again this weekend and possibly next week as well.

Neil picked up the phone with an extremely kind and friendly attitude and helped us make the reservation. During the next two days, out flights got cancelled three times and we had to drag our luggages and change from one room to another. However, the warm service at the hotel made our frustrating trip feel much better. We want to say special thanks to Neil, Brendon, Seth (not sure if I spell his name correctly), and an Asian lady who also worked at the reception desk (sorry that we cannot remember her name). We definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, this is the hotel with the best service which weve experienced in North America.
